project.teaser: An effective platform for the cognitive cloud-edge continuum must address a number of unsolved challenges, many of them derived from constrained resource devices, infrastructure heterogeneity, and the need to meet criteria such as performance, resilience, security, data...
project.objective:
An effective platform for the cognitive cloud-edge continuum must address a number of unsolved challenges, many of them derived from constrained resource devices, infrastructure heterogeneity, and the need to meet criteria such as performance, resilience, security, data sovereignty, and energy efficiency. A disaggregated architecture is required, making use of AI, automation, and portability to manage and adapt resources and workloads, and to respond in real time to possible incidents and security threats.
Edge application developers willing to speed up computation, save energy, and cut costs will need a way to combine their edge devices with the many resources available across the cloud-edge continuum. This innovative approach requires computationally-intensive data processing functions to be easily executed outside edge devices, sensors, and actuators. It is with that vision in mind that this project proposes a new distributed Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) paradigm for edge application management and smart orchestration, which will change how applications and services are deployed and executed in the cloud-edge continuum. Our AI-enabled adaptive serverless framework will provide applications with secure and portable access to a continuous data processing environment that abstracts the large-scale, geo-distributed, and low-latency capabilities provided by the cloud-edge continuum.
The Consortium combines innovative open source companies in Europe, high-impact research organizations, and several edge application providers. Our research will be validated in relevant application domains, and will establish an ecosystem with links to industrial initiatives. This project will be transformative for the emerging EU edge ecosystem, providing resources and knowledge for start-ups, SMEs, and industry leaders seeking to look beyond centralized platforms and hyperscalers. It will increase European autonomy not only in data processing but also in strategic edge technologies.
project.title: A Cognitive Serverless Framework for the Cloud-Edge Continuum

article.title: Progressing towards the next-generation cloud-edge-IoT continuum
article.teaser: EU-backed project releases the reference architecture of its AI-enabled serverless framework for the cloud-edge continuum.

Better object location in industrial environments with AI

result.title: Cognit FaaS Model - Software Source - a
result.description: Software source code of the components developed in tasks T3.1, T3.2, T3.3, and T3.4 is delivered and made public at the end of each cycle in a single deliverable.

result.title: Cognit Serverless Platform - Software Source - a
result.description: Software source code of the components developed in tasks T4.1, T4.2, T4.3, and T4.4 is delivered and made public at the end of each cycle in a single deliverable.

result.title: Cognit FaaS Model - Scientific Report - a
result.description: A single Report delivered at the end of each cycle that summarizes the research and development design performed in tasks T3.1, T3.2, T3.3, and T3.4.

result.title: Cognit Framework - Architecture - c
result.description: D2.[1,2,3,4,5,6]. Cognit Framework Architecture - [a,b,c,d,e,f] (R) (M3, M9, M15, M21, M27, M33)The main version of this deliverable will be released at the end of start phase (M3), with the analysis of use case requirements (T2.1), sovereignty, sustainability, interoperability and security requirements (T2.2), programming model (T2.3), framework architecture (T2.4), and verification (T2.5). The Project will generate incremental releases at the end of each 6-month research cycle (M9, M15, M21, M27, M33) with updates if any in use cases (T2.1), sovereignty, sustainability, interoperability, security requirements (T2.2), and Verification (T2.5).

result.title: Modeling the Green Cloud Continuum: integrating energy considerations into Cloud–Edge models

details.authors: Patel, Y. S., Townend, P., Singh, A., & Östberg, P.-O.

result.title: Use Cases - Scientific Report - c
result.description: The first version of this deliverable will be released at the end of start phase (M3) with the use case requirements. The Project will then generate incremental releases at the end of each 6-month research cycle (M9, M15, M21, M27, M33) with updates (if any) in requirements, a description of the open source integration and certification process, and a description of the research, development, and validation done in the cycle.

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Plan and Report - b
result.description: This document provides information about the Project communication and dissemination plan including the specification of the target dissemination groups, the publication policy, event planning, and marketing. It also reports the dissemination activities that will take place throughout the Project. It is an ongoing deliverable with subsequent, updated versions to be produced in M18 and M36.

category.title: sensors
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/sensors

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
